result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald T Hughes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

Defendant Ronald T Hughes in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement calls for State amending charge to D/C, DE will pay a fine of $50.00 and CC, and V/W surcharge of $67.00.    Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of G, court accepts and finds the DE guilty.
